text: Eduard Kanhäuser, also known as Edi (born 18 September 1901-missing in action 22 May 1944Retrieved 29 August 2022) was an Austrian international footballer. Kanhäuser played as a goalkeeper for Wiener Sport-Club. His brother was fellow player Karl Kanhäuser. He may have died during the Second World War. ==Career == From 1917 to 1928 he played as a goalkeeper for Wiener Sport-Club. Together with his brothers Karl and Johann he played in the team which won the first championship for the club in 1922. From 1931 till 1933 he was manager of Sport-Club. ==International == Kanhäuser played 9 matches for the Austrian national football team. He debuted on 30 April 1922 in a 2-2 versus Hungary. His last match was a 2-0 loss versus Switzerland. ÖFB̠Players profile ==Honours == * Austrian Football Bundesliga: 1922 * Austrian Cupː 1923 ==World War II and death== Kanhauser died on 22 May 1944 aged 42 as German soldier in Italy in the Second world war. ==References== Category:1901 births Category:1944 deaths Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:Austrian football goalkeepers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Austrian football managers Category:Austrian football champions
title: Eduard Kanhäuser
